result.execSummary:
The defendant Shanika M Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any sentence; release for the Day Reporting Center ONLY; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Court notes no objection to an early termination of probation if after 2 years the defendant has met all conditions of probation without any violation.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. Any cash bail on deposit to apply.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription for the defendant or for any child the defendant has legal custody for taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant may not live where controlled substances or drug paraphernalia is located. No contact with any known drug user or contact at a place where illegal drug paraphernalia is used.
Defendant may not live or work where a firearm is located.
Defendant may not ride in a car where a firearm is located.

Defendant must comply with Court orders regarding children.
Defendant must comply with all orders from Bureau of Child Welfare or Child Protective Services.
Provide a DNA sample, if not already done.

Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shanika M Thomas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Profile of Wisconsin Female Prison Population with attachements, received and filed.

Defendant Shanika M Thomas in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski. Brandon Wigley for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
ORIGINAL COURT FILE IS UNAVAILABLE. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for the Day Reporting Center ONLY; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription for the Defendant or for any child the Defendant has legal custody for
  taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live or work where a firearm is located.
- Defendant may not ride in a car where a firearm is located.
 - Defendant may not live where controlled substance or drug paraphernalia is located. No contact with any known drug user or contact at a place where illegal drug paraphernalia is used. 
- Defendant must comply with Court orders regarding children.
-Defendant must comply with all orders from Bureau of Child Welfare or Child Protective Services.
- Maintain fulltime work and/or school.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
-Court imposes and stays 90 days of condition time, without good time credit, release for work only, and the Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Condition time to be imposed at the discretion of the Department of Corrections as follows:
*20 days for a 1st positive drug or alcohol test;
*30 days for a 2nd positive drug or alcohol test;
*40 days for a 3rd positive drug or alcohol test.

Court notes no objection to an early termination of probation if after 2 years the Defendant has met all conditions of probation without any violation. 

Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. Any cash bail on deposit to apply.


Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Defendant Shanika M Thomas in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Final Pretrial. Case proceeds to Plea Hearing.   
AS TO COUNT  2- 
The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
AS TO COUNT 3-
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 3 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Jury Trial scheduled for February 2, 2015 is vacated. 
Case is adjourned for Sentencing on 2-26-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.

Defendant Shanika M Thomas in court with attorney Ramon Valdez for Paul A. Ksicinski. Paul Hauer for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Final Pretrial. For the reasons placed on the record Attorney Ksicinski is not present today and the case is adjourned for Final Pretrial on 1-28-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.
Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 2-2-2015 at 9:00 a.m.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
from Assistant District Attorney Danielle Chojnacki, received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Shanika M Thomas in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  Paul Hauer for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court for projected guilty plea.  Defense counsel requests an adjourned plea date due to defendant feeling ill.  Court orders case adjourned for Final pretrial and Jury trial in Branch 17.
Any Defense motion is due no later than 9-26-2014 by 5:00 p.m. and any reply from the State is due no later than 10-24-2014 by 5:00 p.m.  Calendar call scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 05:00 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 05:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shanika M Thomas in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests case be set for Plea Hearing. Court orders case adjourned for Plea Hearing on 9-22-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shanika M Thomas in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  Paul Hauer for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests adjournment to allow time to review discovery. State does not object to an adjournment. Court orders case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 9-10-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shanika M Thomas in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense states he has been recently appointed and does not have a copy of the complaint or discovery as of yet. Court orders case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Br. 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shanika M Thomas in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Attorney Toran
informs court that there defendant now qualifies for PD representation.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel.  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the safety building.  Status conference scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant Shanika M Thomas in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defense counsel enters a not guilty plea to misdemeanor count 3.  
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
